results.title: Fisherman's gamble
results.creator_credit: Ray Jones and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A sea hunt for swordfish off the Nova Scotia coast. A swordfish is more like a torpedo than a fish and, with five feet of boat-piercing armour for a nose, it is almost as deadly. Catching one is an exciting test of strength, with some anxious moments.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ray Jones and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Reckless Kelly (Director's cut)
results.creator_credit: Yahoo Serious, Warwick Ross and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Reckless Kelly is a biker, a republican, a video rental addict, a man of the 90’s and the last of the great bank-robbing gang left to right the wrongs of the world. And he’s doing it his way; holding up autoteller machines and re-depositing the money into the bank accounts of the poor. Good overcomes evil and justice conquers corruption, when our legendary armour-clad hero ventures from the outback of Australia and heads off to the wild world of Hollywood and Las Vegas. Backed by a hit soundtrack featuring INXS, Divinyls, Yothu Yindi and Mental as Anything. Cast includes Yahoo Serious, Melora Hardin, Alexei Sayle, Hugo Weaving, Kathleen Freeman, John Pinette, Bob Maza.

results.title: Fishtank
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description:
A high-rise flat in the U.K. Midlands. Ray is the father who drinks, Liz the mother, Jason the brother. There are some animals and the brother kills flies. The older brother films them with his handycam - intently observing whatever is going on.

In 1996 Richard Billingham’s ‘Ray’s a Laugh’ was hailed as the photo book of the decade. His photographs were one of the talking points of ‘Sensation’. Billingham has now made ‘Fishtank’, a commission for television by Artangel in collaboration with film-maker Adam Curtis and Illuminations TV for BBC2’s acclaimed TV series. The ‘video verite’ of Fishtank is contained within the compressed space/fishtank of the flat. Sometimes they talk, sometimes they argue. Billingham’s film registers the emotional temperature of this space and the family who live there with a closeness that transcends camera conventions. Like the paintings of Lucian Freud, Billingham crafts a terrible beauty from the landscape of family life and its patterns of pathos, despair and hope.

results.title: First steps
results.creator_credit: Alec MacLeod, Philip Bridgeman, Colin Low, Stanley Jackson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Overview of a Canadian program called “First steps” which is designed to provide extra stimulation and structured learning situations for children who are born with intellectual retardation. Suitable for tertiary levels. (Awards: Vancouver; Columbus; Salerno).

results.title: Fishtank
results.creator_credit: Denis Quinn, Marie-Louise Simpson, Queensland University of Technology and Super Fresh Oyster Films
results.brief_description: An adult reflects on a time in his youth when he used to wait for his father at the Regatta Hotel in Queensland during the sixties. It was a time when the muffled mutterings at the bar concerned issues such as women, pictures, and what it meant to be part of the “lucky country”. It was a men’s club, one legally and morally off limits to women, until 2 of them enter the bar, and, after being evicted handcuff themselves to the bar as a form of protest. Based on a true event and narrated by Daniel Rowan. Cast includes Dave Robinson, Damien Donowan, Stephen Collins, Liesel Badorrek and Kyrra Mickelborough.

results.title: First day
results.creator_credit: Gordon Glenn, Patricia Edgar, Australian Children's Television Foundation and Film Finance Corporation Australia
results.brief_description: The first day of school is a major step in the developmental process of children everywhere. This program follows 11 new starters from various religious, ethnic and socio-economic backgrounds on their first day of school. Tim, the child of a fourth generation farming family in the Mallee, Sarah from Melbourne’s Turkish community, Roland, only child going to school in Rose Bay, Sydney, twins Kate and Jessie, Isaac in Nimbin, Ashleigh from a new housing estate in Melbourne’s East, Matthew and Jessie, twins with special needs, Sam, heading to a one teacher school and Gurrupiya, a small school in North Eastern Arnhem Land. Parents, family and friends discuss how their children have been raised and how it has contributed to their eduction skills thus far. Features footage of children on their first day of school and the thoughts and emotions they are experiencing. Research co-ordinator: Annemarie O’Brien. Narrator: Gordon Glenn.

results.title: First contact
results.creator_credit: Stewart Young, Dick Smith Adventure, Robin Anderson, Bob Connolly and Arundel Productions
results.brief_description: Documents the clash of two cultures that occurred in the 1930s when the people of the highlands of New Guinea encountered the first Europeans to enter their world. One of these Australians, Michael Leahy, took a movie camera with him.

constellations_other.name: Bob Connolly
constellations_other.description: Australian audiences just can't seem to get enough of exploring local governments, bureaucracy and politics, whether that's through documentaries or biting social satire.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Stewart Young, Dick Smith Adventure, Robin Anderson, Bob Connolly and Arundel Productions
results.description: Documents the clash of two cultures that occurred in the 1930s when the people of the highlands of New Guinea encountered the first Europeans to enter their world - for an El Dorado. One of these Australians, Michael Leahy, took a movie camera with him, and so managed to capture on film the confrontation between one civilisation and the representatives of another.

One of these Australians, Michael Leahy, took a movie camera with him, and so managed to capture on film the confrontation between one civilisation and the representatives of another.

results.title: First citizen: Albert Namatjira
results.creator_credit: John Tristram, I. James Wilson and Juniper Films
results.brief_description: First Citizen charts the life of aboriginal painter, Albert Namatjira. Born in 1902, Albert Namatjira rose to star status through the acceptance of his art by white Australia in the 1950s. As a result, he was awarded Australian citizenship in 1958. What followed was an often tragic life, caught between white Australian and Aboriginal cultures.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Tristram, I. James Wilson and Juniper Films

results.title: First break
results.creator_credit: Derek Rogers, Adrienne Amato, Silva Basmajian and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The ongoing struggle of living with a diagnosed mental illness is portrayed in this program through candid interviews over one year with three teenagers, who are experiencing mental illness, and their families. Their personal stories, shared with great sensitivity and honesty, illuminate the challenges and dis-orientating effects of mental illness as well as its impact on their conception of their self-identities and their relationships with family and friends. As the camera follows the course of their lives over this period we are given an insight into their own hopes, strengths and achievements as well as their frustrations in dealing with their mental illness in every day life. “First Break” also questions the stigmatised view of mental illness through these very personal stories, providing a portrait of young people coping with their experiences and the powerful changes it has meant for their own as well as their families lives.
